channel.title: Help with Jarring
channel.description:
Well, i have 1 problem jarring my client.
In Eclipse, everything works fine, cachedownloader works fine, loading the cache loads fine too :P
Then i've created a batch file, it worked pretty smooth too.
Now, i tryed jarring, but nothing works.
My client is a packaged PI client,
Html to launch applet: (IT'S LOCAL, CALM YO TITS)
[code]<center> <applet name="Server.." width="765" height="503" archive="file:\\C:\Users\Username..\Desktop\JAR\client.jar" code="Client.class"> <param name="java_arguments" value="-Xmx1024m"/> </applet></center>[/code]
This is my error:
[b]NoClassDefFoundError[/b] [i]Client (wrong name: com/Client)[/i]
Details: [code]CacheEntry[file:/C:/Users/DJ-Cosmo/Desktop/JAR/client.jar]: updateAvailable=true,lastModified=Fri Jan 31 18:52:34 CET 2014,length=496375 Missing Application-Name manifest attribute for: file:/C:/Users/DJ-Cosmo/Desktop/JAR/client.jar Java-Plug-in 10.51.2.13 JRE-Version 1.7.0_51-b13 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM User-Home-Directory = C:\Users\DJ-Cosmo[/code]
Tryed many manifests: Client client com.client com.Client GUI EGUI
Anyone?

item.title: Help with Jarring
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:6, topic:539472”][quote author=xXSh0ckXx link=topic=658311.msg4404307#msg4404307 date=1391436675]

http://lmgtfy.com/?q=how+to+jar+a+rsps+client

This was the worst motherf*cking answer i’ve ever read you spastic, if you could read it’s a PACKAGED client. Your answers have no guidance either, stop trying to get post counts up!

Kind regards,
Sh0ck

There’s no difference between a more packaged source to a barely packaged source.

Who’s talking about source’s? There is a difference between packaged clients and normal clients when it comes to jarring, don’t emberasse yourself
[/quote]
Every client is packaged maybe barely but it is in a file isn’t it. It’s the exact same process and stop being a asshole on your own thread your asking for help and people are trying to help.[/quote]
I’m not an asshole! It’s just annoying how people wanna get post count up by telling me ‘GOOGLE’ or giving me an extern link with ‘PI JARRING’, This is NOT helping, just farming.
These people are just trolls and have no idea of what they’re talking about. Stop defending them. Btw. how you mean it is in the file?

xx matty xx:

Calm yo tits mate, it’s the exact same process - you just need to add the package names in front of the class name.

Which class name? You mean of the manifest?

Read full topic
